Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pap0707
Reviews.Content: The location is great, 5-7 walk to the airport bus stop, cathedral right around the corner, 5-7 minutes walk to several metro stops. The rooms are a little small and storage space could be larger, but this is typical for European rooms. If you want a large American room stay at an American chain hotel like Hilton/Marriott. All we did was sleep in the room so size was not an issue. We found the staff friendly and helpful. We did not eat at the hotel, too many bakeries in the neighborhood to have breakfast at for a lot less than the hotels charge. WiFi was occasionally weak, but this was not really an issue. Overall I can't really think of anything negative to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “well located big comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: rogilboa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Gotiqhe quarter by the Ramblas. Beautiful modern and very comfortable designing, quite , at short distance from the great location of Barcelona -perfect for visitors. The stuff was polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: manu_lopez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the center of the city. Rooms are clean and have been reformed recently. Even though it's central location, at night it was quite in our room (with terrace and access to the rooftop pool). Friendly and helpful staff. Wireless connection is very good and it's free. Spacious shower (overhead). We had no meals in the hotel. From the rooftop pool you have a glimpse at the Catedral.

Reviews.Title: “Easy accessible and modern hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TomoB
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotel is easy accessible. I arrived in Barcelona by plane and used Aerobus service to come to Placa de Catalunya in around 30 minutes. From bus stop in Placa de Catalunya it takes only 5 minutes of easy walking down shopping street Portal d'Angel to arrive to hotel. It has fantastic location, few minutes from La Rambla, Placa de Catalunya or Port Vell. Hotel itself is situated in an historic building in Barri Gothic, medieval center of Barcelona, just a minute away from Barcelona Cathedral. It is newly redecorated with very modern furniture and it could be easily cold boutique hotel. You can choose between room facing street or facing beautiful inner courtyard designed like zen garden. I choose former because they were more peaceful. Room itself is also modern, have air condition and free wireless internet. Highlight for me were terrace at the top of the hotel with relaxing area and pool overlooking Barcelona Barri Gothic roofs, and live music in restaurant at night (girl singing accompanied with man playing acoustic guitar). Hotel stuff are all very pleasant and replied quickly and friendly to every request I had. I didn't took breakfast at hotel because it was 19 Euros. There are a lot of nice places where you can eat far cheaper. I personally enjoyed having breakfast at El Mos in Carrer Comtal and in Buenas Miguas foccaceria just at the back side of cathedral. All at all easy accessible hotel in the middle of Barcelona, modern ambient and helpful stuff! Definitely planning to come back here next time I visit this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, excellent situation”
Reviews.Author: MARISADO
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its situation. Certainly it is great: just in front of the cathedral, in the Gothic old town of Barcelona. When we arrived, staff was so kind, correct, professional that everything was easy for us. The Hotel has been reformed recently and it is a beautiful building inside. On the first floor there is a restaurant -didn't eat there (sorry)-, a cafeteria with a nice small terraze and nice sitting rooms. There, we changed lift to go to the rooms. Rooms - at least ours!- are great: big, nice decoration, lots of light, modern, prefectly clean. The bathroom is big, modern and very clean. Adecuate amenities and it's also possible to take a cup of tea (not common in Spain) On the top floor there is a swimming pool and terraze, very nice views and confortable to spend the day sunbathing even in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent .”
Reviews.Author: Silli-gilli
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, right in the centre of Barcelona, Approximately a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas. The hotel is very clean and comfortable with extremely helpful staff. Breakfast was good but didn't eat in restaurant in evening, there is so much choice out and about. The hotel is a definite must . We were three to a room and there was ample space for all of us (all adults). The hotel helped to make my stay relaxing and enjoyable. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star hotel at 4 star rates”
Reviews.Author: structed
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in March and had a wonderful time in Barcelona. I highly recommend that you spend time walking the city as it has so much to offer other than the usual tourist spots. This hotel was nice, but definitely not a 4 star place. We stayed in a double room in the rear and had quite a bit of noise during the evening into late at night. The room was average size with none of the 4 star amenities that usually accompany that classification, no bathrobes, no slippers, no tissues in the bath... The hotel staff has friendly and helpful however the room was somewhat dusty and the floors were not cleaned every day. On our fourth day the room was made up much too late (after 3:30) and was obviously done in a hurry. We did not try the restaurant as it was much more expensive than the surrounding places. We found many wonderful restaurants within a few blocks of the Hotel. We paid 150e a night which I feel was too expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal city hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravellingErwin
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Catedral is perfectly situated in the Barri Gotic, allowing to stroll in either direction to explore the city. Being close to Placa Catelunya, it was very easy to get there from the airport. The staff was friendly and professional, the rooms modern and clean. We didn't use any further amenities as our primary objective was to get to know Barcelona. For that purpose, the hoel was a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel already are about spot on. Very clean and modern. Friendly service and we were allowed to check in early. I were not asked if we needed a twin or double and had to ask twice for this to be changed. Great bathroom, bath and shower. We didn't try the breakfast as found 15 euros each a bit steap especially when you can have two meals and coffee for just that a short walk away. Very pretty setting,just be careful wandering around in the narrow passages at night, i wouldn't encourage enyone to do this alone. The food is better in some placed=s than others - tends to be off the main drag of la rambla. Sight seeing tours well worth the money if you go on two or more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: UllaCph
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location only 5 min walk from Plaza Catalunuya and the airport bus. Friendly staff. Big clean room and big bathroom, but we missed some coat hooks at the bathroom. We had two toilet bags with “hangers”, but we could not hang them anywhere. The balcony door didn’t have a door handle, so we couldn’t get fresh air (and it would be a problem in case of fire). In spite of the big room, there was only one armchair in our double room. There were a lot of pillows, but all of them were too high and too hard. We found the breakfast too expensive (16 euro each person), so we didn’t try it. Just some steps away you can buy cheap coffee and sandwiches, and in the neighbourhood it is easy to find really good breakfast for less than 10 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Appropriate choice, but with remarks”
Reviews.Author: Th0rnt0ns
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and safe. The hotel is very clean. Staff were mostly helpful. Double room ought to have one queen or king size bed as the picture implied in the booking website. However, they were two single beds brought together and it was not comfortable as they were sliding away. The towels were not soft at all. No slippers. The restaurant/bar is located in the first floor near the rooms and there were a couple of parties held there those lasted until midnight where it was too noisy that we couldn't sleep. Therefore, I would recommend having a room away from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location, satisfactory quality"”
Reviews.Author: andreaRome
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a very convenient location for Barrio Gotico and Catedral. Reception and room service very satisfactory and professional. Rooms are small but well equipped and clean, bathroom is big. We did not try breakfast (bit expensive) and restaurant. Everything to visit is at walking distance. Suitable for week end visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tobey W
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Catedral is a very nice boutique hotel in a wonderful location in the charming Barri Gotic. In spite of its proximity to so many crowded sites, it's very quiet. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. We spent 5 nights here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: Willem_van_Dongen
Reviews.Content: Young and enthusiastic staff greeted me. Clean, proper room. Very centrally located in the Barri Gotic, a quarter where my Spanish connections otherwise warned me against not to roam after dark. No worries, only had business/sight-seeing in daytime anyways and was at walking distance from the Ramblas and medieval sights in Barcelona. Good food in the restaurant; I had to double-check bills, though, when checking out as the system of 'charging-food-to-rooms' did not seem perfected yet. No worries either, if I hadn't checked, I would have been under-charged ;-). The receptionist very sweetly asked me to write a review, as the hotel 'only had been working a couple of years and we like to learn'. That's the spirit! Kudos to Kyle et al :-).

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bfgs
Reviews.Content: we stayed for two nights. location is perfect , very close to catalunia plaza.in the middle of all the shopping area. however, the aircondition did not work so we were very cold on our first night. a big con for me were the wool blankets instead of duvet covers which are not sutible for a new four star hotel! breakfast was a bit poor.

Reviews.Title: “I've spent a lot more money on much worse hotels.”
Reviews.Author: tomototo
Reviews.Content: Great place. The staff seem genuinely pleased to meet requests. Not sure if it was a special deal but it's a very nice hotel for the money (we paid 110 euros for a night). Tip is ... if you want a cab and you have big bags, give yourself 10-15 minutes and ask the hotel to get one to pull out up front. It's a pedestrian street, so otherwise you have to walk a couple of hundred metres to the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Quiet and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Adrian&Rohan
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Barcelona at the Catalonia Catedral after a Cruise from Venice and couldn't have found a better more central place to stay. The location was excellent, being in the centre of the Gothic Area in a pedestrian zone, so although there were people around, it was fairly quite. Very central to the Ramblas, many historical sites and musems, the hop on hop off bus stops and the shopping areas. Also close enough to walk down to La Barceloneta and the beach area but then we like walking as you see so much more. We were there early as we had just come off the cruise ship (Holland America - ms Nieuw Amsterdam) so our room was not yet ready but then we didn’t expect it to be so we Check in and left our bags and went out exploring for the day. We stayed in a Superior terrace room on the top floor with access to the pool (just be careful as we found out the room keys didn’t let us back in to out courtyard from the pool, so you could get locked out. Reported this but never did get it fixed or find out if they were meant to work. Only downside of rooms on this floor were the glass walkways and lift which were very hot to get to and from the room. The room itself was very quiet, clean but could have had more space to put suitcases. Bathroom was very large with big rainwater showerhead and heated full wall mirror (great for not steaming upo but did heat up the bathroom). Bottled water was provided daily and Wi-Fi was included but like other reviewers have written the Wi-Fi was down for several days during our stay. Pool area was nice on the roof top looking out to another Hotels pool area opposite. Breakfast was very good and special thanks to Matteu??? who served us and brought us coffee each morning at breakfast and always just looked so happy to be there and help and serve you, a real asset to the Hotel. Reception staff were also very good and helpful with directions and taxis etc. Better than being on the Ramblas. Location was perfect and we would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: sharon h
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an aerobus ride from airport and a short walk from city center, just around the corner from the Cathedral. It was clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. Our balcony overlooked the shopping area down stairs. It was a bit noisy, but we enjoyed the hustle and bustle of this time of year. Christmas markets just around the corner as well.

Reviews.Title: “Catalonia Catedral was excellent”
Reviews.Author: LucyN4141
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. Quiet but very well located. Immaculate. I would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location good value Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haworths
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed very close to the Xmas market excellent location very central clean hotel

Reviews.Title: “Special place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EMJoyce
Reviews.Content: This is such a sweet hotel. We stayed three nights and had a superior terrace room. It had a beautiful bathroom with an amazing shower. The room had a pull out sofa for our daughter separated by a partition from our bed which gave everyone a little privacy, we had a little balcony that opened up on to the pool. Even though it was late November we sat out on the pool deck in the morning. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The neighborhood is pretty, full of shops and restaurants, much nicer than Las Ramblas which is too touristy and getting a little seedy. This is the place to stay. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Very good room”
Reviews.Author: othello2000
Reviews.Content: Medium sized hotel, very nicely renovated, in the center of the city, where no cars enter with many shops around and lots of people passing... I think this bit of Barcelona is the best area to book your hotel. Next to it is also Barcelona Catedral, which is a similar hotel. - The road is Avinguda del Portal de l'Angel which is parallel to Las Ramblas, ends on the Placa Catalunya just like Las Ramblas, has no motor traffic and is very beautiful. Rooms are well equipped, clean and new. Satellite TV with many languages, free coffee and tea in the room, stocked fridge, very good mattress and choice of 3 pillows, well stocked bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vasilis S
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in perfect location!Walking distances to everything(La Ramblas,Catalunia Plaza,El Born,etc)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Amr G
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, new and clean. The staff are very helpful and speak English. Would stay there if back in Barca. My only comment is that rooms with the nice view (Plaza Nova) have 2 beds. meaning if you are a couple you will get a poor view

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Annbirdsall
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our entire stay, 8-Nov 2, 2011. Our room was on the back of the hotel, overlooking an alleyway, so a bit noisy on the weekend, but I expect that in a lively, happening city like Barcelona. Otherwise, we found the rooms very quiet. We arrived around 9:30 am and were delighted that we could get in our room. The staff was very helpful, spoke excellent English; the breakfast buffet is excellent in choice, variety and service, the the location of the hotel, top notch. We would stay there again in a heart beat. Shower was wonderful as it had a 'rain shower' shower head and plenty of room. Clean, great location, excellent staff, food.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: noam o
Reviews.Content: Second time in Barcelona. I've seen many corners of the city & this hotel has the perfect location. It's new, clean, modern & great service. We love barcelona & no doubt we'll get back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: johnnytropics
Reviews.Content: Was in Barcelona for a 4 day conference out at the international conference hall, and 3 days of sightseeing. Didn't want to stay out in a high rise hotel near the conference center, but choose to stay in old town at Catalonia Catedral, and it was likely the best decision of the stay. The hotel is lovely--reasonable sized room for double occupancy, nice breakfast, right in the centre of activities in the old part of town--architecture, restaruants, cafes, museums, shopping, music venues--all virtually outside your door in a very safe appearing part of town. If you're looking for a quiet, pastoral, setting, go somewhere else. This is in the centre of town, so some street noise is inevitable. As far as quirky lifts--the stairs worked without fail every time! A pleasant 6 minute walk brings one to the inexpensive, clean Metro system, from which the large conference centre was accessible within about another 16 minutes. The harbour is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel, so all in all, it has to be one of the best locations in town. Barcelona is great.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives, with a few quirks to note”
Reviews.Author: JMLT_NS
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location is fantastic. The hotel is very clean and everything is in good working order. (The elevator arrangement is odd as others noted, we had no issues but be warned that some patience is required). The walls and windows were soundproof. The staff were friendly and helpful. Cons: I had ordered a superior room and was initially pleased that we received one on the front of the picturesque hotel with its metal balconies. Unfortunately, the balconies are not to be used and staff are supposed to be called whenever you want to open the windows (the handle had been removed). I can appreciate that there is a safety concern and that has to take precedence over all other considerations but this limitation certainly detracts from the room. The superior room also has a sitting area (sofa). In our case, the sofa was in an area isolated from the sleeping area by a corridor and bathroom. There was no table or TV near the sofa. If we had been traveling with another person (or a child), it would have been a great setup to gain some privacy for the sofa bed. However, as a sitting area, it was not very useful so we asked to change rooms. The staff understood our concern and were able to accommodate our request after the first night in which the hotel was fully booked. I never used the restaurant or bar so I can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Takster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catelonia Catedral for 1 night in Barcelona. The hotel is easy to find, head for the Cathedral towards Placa Catalyna. Its in a great location with lots around. The staff are very friendly and Kyle who shows you up to your rooms is a cutie! Anyway, right outside the hotel is a cash point and its fairly easy to get access to locat transport. You wont be able to drive to the hotel though as its pedestrianised, so if you have a car be mindful of this. I cannot fault the hotel in anyway, bar was nice, the hotel is modern and clean. It was a steal for the price i paid £115 a night for 2 people. The Ramblas is within 10mins walking distance. Definately would recommend this hotel to everyone and stay there again. We didnt have a problem sleeping, though the dustbin men will come round quite early so you will hear this. Free Wi-Fi available and we didnt have a problem with the coverage. The local restaurants nearby are good and worth visiting if you dont want to pay the Ramblas prices.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: RichmondRose
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a rather unprepossessing reception but our room was fine with plenty of hanging space and shelves. The shower was good. Barcelona has soft water so the bath, shower and taps were sparkling clean. In fact the whole hotel is kept very clean. We asked for a quiet room which we got. The downside was that it looked onto an inner courtyard but as we were out all day we didn’t mind. We never had breakfast there as on our first day there were no tables available so we found a small café round the corner called El Mos. This turned out to be a good find as it is cheerfully run by very nice girls, is frequented by locals and serves excellent coffee, fresh orange juice and pastries. To find it, turn right out of the hotel, walk up Av. Portal l'Angel until you come to Zara where you turn right. El Mos is a little way down the sidestreet. An earlier comment about the airport bus was good advice. There’s no need to take a taxi from the airport. The airport bus leaves every 6 minutes and will drop you in Catalonia Square. Walk down Av. Portal l'Angel, bear left at the bottom, and you arrive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly modern hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaClose
Reviews.Content: Pros: • Incredible breakfast - good healthy options as well as the usual smorgasbord • Helpful and friendly staff • Well located, across from the Catedral, near a post office, lots of shopping cafe’s and tapas bars in walking distance. • Super clean and modern room • Really comfortable bed and pillows • Lovely clean modern bathroom with fresh fluffy towels • Scales in the room were handy for weighing our baggage before our Ryan air flight (although slightly depressing to see those extra holiday kilos haha) • Competitively priced Cons: • The window of our room opened up into the breakfast area – so basically we couldn’t open the curtains unless we wanted people staring at us. • Rooms had a very modern design, if you’re looking for a touch of Spain in your hotel or more of a homely feel it’s probably not the place for you. • Found the free wifi was painfully slow

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Thebairds
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel built onto beautiful old facade. Location has to be the biggest plus point, next to Cathedral and shopping and very close to Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya; from which you can access most tourist and travel options like the Metro, Trains, Buses and tourist Information. Check in at reception was okay, not particularly welcoming. Hotel itself was vey nice, contemporary and spotless. Room was on third floor, (312) which required taking two separate elevators, felt quite small but was nicely appointed. Bed was comfortable! Couldn't really open the drapes on the window as it looked into the internal courtyard and onto the glass elevators that run up the courtyard's inside wall. Had a drink at bar where service could have been better but did not eat in the hotel as there are too many places out with to choose from. Rooftop pool a great facility to have in the city with a telephone bar service, towels and a vending machine. Would return to hotel for the excellent location but did feel it was a little impersonal. Not so much a welcoming haven to rest from a busy day in the city but more of a clean and convenient place to lay your head!

Reviews.Title: “not a good start to the holiday but did improve eventually”
Reviews.Author: nikkiemotions8
Reviews.Content: We had booked into the Catalonia Ramblas and when we arrived we were told they had no rooms for us as all fully booked-I had the booking from Booking.com who I rang and they said it appeared the Hotel had not stated to them that it was fully booked and so the Hotel moved us on to the Catalonia Catedral instead. I was so upset at the time because I had spent ages reading reviews on hotels etc and believed this hotel to be one of the better ones.We were pleasantly surprised by the Hotel which was near to all the shops and central to everywhere really. The Air Conditioning was NOT GOOD and I had to complain about it-as the room was stifling.The RoofTop Pool was great but there was a problem ordering drinks round the pool- and the ice continually ran out and happy hour consisted of one choice of cocktail! The rooms were clean and spacious . There is problems with the wifi and internet access and even the laptops in the bar area did not work. The breakfast was FANTASTIC! The children really loved the breakfasts. Also the hotel lovely and quiet and relaxed.Second time to Barcelona- we came here in 2010 and loved the beach and the shopping and the buildings! Problems with restaurants as not enough choice of restaurants unless you like tapas, which we don't as had a bad experniece with Tapas last year- so we like Rossini which is in Place Reial and Princesa the beach Bar,the Hard Rock Cafe which gets very busy and Gloria's. We recommend the Boat trips and the cable cars-the views are magnificent! Look for the little fairy cafe as well-!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobwake3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel ! The room was a descent size and sparkling clean, The staff was very cordial and helpful. We were able to walk to many interesting places becaues of the excellent location. The hotel doesnt look like much from the outside but it was lovely inside. Didn't have breakfast there so I cant comment on that.Having a pool was a blessing was able to cool off after a day of sight seeing and shopping. I would come back

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: BSahin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for 1 week for business issue. hotel is in the middle of the city centre, just few minutes walk to las ramblas. there is a catedral too and the picasso museum was really close to the hotel. you just walk with your lagguages for a while thats it. Rooms were really good and clean. Breakfast was really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: COTTIESouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Our family had an excellent stay at this hotel. We had 2 rooms one for my two children aged 22 and 14, and the other for my husband and I. They were extremely modern and spotlessly clean. Ours was the larger room. The location is perfect as you are in the major shopping area and just a few minutes walk to Las Ramblas and to the Gaudi Catedral. When you return in the late afternoon there is a pool and deck to relax before heading out again. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Location = Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: meridionale
Reviews.Content: There are two things in life that give me anxiety (okay maybe more...), getting the perfect seat at a theater or concert and that first moment you walk into the hotel you booked for a vacation. If you are one of these people, you will breath an enormous amount of relief followed by a huge smile at the Catalonia Catedral. This was our first time in Barcelona, so beyond google maps and tripadvisor, narrowing it down to one hotel was a shot in the dark. We stayed in a superior room, which is my understanding is a bit bigger than the regular rooms. Our bed was comfortable, lots of pillows, fluffy towels, plenty of closet space, and an a/c that pleased. The staff were always warm, friendly, and personable, even at 4:45am when I am pacing back and forth waiting for my buddy to get back from the bar because we have to go to the airport at 5am. And yes, they always have someone at the desk. At night, they lock the doors and the person can see if someone approaches and will open, so you will feel very safe in this place. The bad? Before you read this, just let me say I hate typing anything bad about a hotel I liked. All hotels have their quirks, and considering the location of the hotel, I wouldn't really think the "bad" is limited to this hotel. That said - at night the hotel is so quiet, you could hear a pin drop. I'm someone who needs white noise, so this made it hard for me to sleep. But then since the hotel is so quiet, as soon as housekeeping starts at 7am, you hear it. Luckily the shops and action don't get cranked up until 11:30am/noon, so you're fine there. The other annoying thing was the internet. They do have free wireless, but I think because of the location, it's probably not the most wireless friendly setting. Sun-Wed while there, we got spotty internet, but by Wednesday evening, we were never able to get on again. Even the laptops downstairs didn't work. HOWEVER, the staff said we were welcome to go to any of their sister hotels (one was not even a minute walk away) and use the internet there. The Amazing: Staff is awesome, location is awesome. I don't speak spanish, so being able to jump in a cab and just tell them "Catedral" made it so easy to get back to the hotel. You have it all right there - the Catedral, Rambla right around the corner, the port is a 10 minute walk away, metro stops at Catalunya, Rambla, and behind the Catedral. Never had problems getting a cab thanks to the Catedral and Placa Catalunya. Shopping all around, food, ice cream, ahhh....I miss it so much and I haven't even been gone a week. Also, we arrived in Barcelona at 9am, and they offered to keep our bags and bring them up to our room for check-in time around 2:00/2:30. Bottom line: Even with the whole wireless internet frustration, I never once thought I wished we stayed somewhere else. I'm a hotel snob, and I don't regret the 7 nights we spent there at all. I would stay again, just this time, I'd buy something that made some white noise for sleeping. But full disclosure, I own a very loud snoring pug and have slept with a desk fan on every night for the past 5 years. I never sleep good in quiet hotels. So, take it with a grain of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are so friendly and accomodating! The location is wonderful, the price is very reasonable and the rooms are spotless and modern. It was our newly wed daughter and son-in-law's first trip to Europe and this hotel was our first stop. It was the perfect introduction. The hotel has so much atmosphere and the staff is unpretentious, warm and friendly. I chose the hotel via TripAdvisor, so I was hoping it was everything I read. It was!! And more. We will be going back to Barcelona and we will stay at the Catalonia Catedral.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Sami_Piia
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, could not be better. Rooms are made with high quality materials and are very modern. Our Roof terrace was outstanding. Bed was very comfortable and staff was friendly. Basically only minus was, that internet was not working from thursday to tuesday, but it is only a small problem in this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Gemz0
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with our choice of hotel. It is ideally situated in a seemingly quiet location next to the Cathedral at the end of one of the main pedestrianised shopping streets -Portal d'Angel . We took the airport bus to Placa Catalunya and then it was just a straightforward five minute walk down Portal d'Angel. Don't bother with a taxi as the transfer was so easy and only 5 Euros 50 cents per person. Buses are efficient and run to each airport terminal every 10 mins. All the shops our teenage daughter wanted were on the doorstep!! - Bershka, Mango, H&M, Zara etc. The Ramblas, old town, Cathedral, Port and Metro are all very close. The hotel is modern and seems to be newly furbished.It felt cool and airy. The rooftop pool/garden area with sunbeds was relaxing and surprisingly peaceful- not very big but enough to cool down at the end of the day! Towels are provided. A drink service was available from the bar but a bucket of ice and glasses were provided which was handy for our own drinks which we took up ourselves. We only had breakfast at the hotel and it was of a good standard. All staff were polite and helpful. We had 3 beds in our room which made it a little short of space but by no means cramped. Furnishings were nice and the decor was modern and tasteful. The bathroom had a lovely big shower & towels were changed / toiletries replenished daily. The bar had two laptops providing free internet access. We would certainly recommend the hotel and definitely stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zebracat
Reviews.Content: The location is impeccable, right in the gothic quarter, yet you could not hear any noise from the street in your room. Tell taxi drivers to drop you off at the Placa Catedral (the hotel is right on the corner) because it's difficult to get there as it is in a pedestrian zone. I can't complain about anything here. Very friendly service everywhere, beautifully decorated hotel and rooms (great shower, enough space, a variety of 3 different pillows and a very powerful hair dryer for those who need one!). Breakfast was excellent, so was the coffee. A little advice, ask for coffee from the machine, not the one they pour into your mug at the table. 10x better! Oh yes and a very nice and quiet pool on the roof of the hotel. If I ever go back to Barcelona I'll definitely go back here. It might be slightly pricier than other options but we hardly ever took public transport or taxis as you can easily walk to many places like Placa Catalunya, las Ramblas, or Port Vell.. So as you'll save up money in that regard I cannot complain!

Reviews.Title: “definetely ok!”
Reviews.Author: studiomarcone
Reviews.Content: i recomand the restaurant very good and not expensive. marvellous position in the center of barcelona and very confortable with aereoport trans ( catalunya square) and metro lines ( the barcelona metro' is superlative!!!).the hotel is in the centre of "barrio gotic" and really few meters from the ancient roman walls of barcelona ,near the beatiful catedral of the city

Reviews.Title: “I fell a little bit in love with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Disco_Lulu
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night, but staff were amazing and so helpful. A special mention to Alex and Mark who allowed me to practice my terrible spanish on them! As the hotel wasn't full we were offered an upgrade - room was lovely with an amazing bed and shower. Rooftop pool was a massive bonus after a day of sightseeing. Will definitely stay again when I'm next in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Family”
Reviews.Author: DetroitBaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to our Mediterranean cruise. We had two rooms, one for my husband and I, and another for our teenage boys (one who is in a wheelchair). The front desk staff were extremely nice. The bellman Kyle was extremely friendly and helpful as well. The front desk staff speak english very well. The location was convenient and allowed us to walk everywhere. I have two suggestions I would recommend to the hotel: 1. Improve the directions provided on the website as to how to reach the hotel by taxi. Our cab driver drove around about 10 times around the block before he figured out where the hotel was. 2). The staff working in the bar area were not as attentive as the front desk staff. We waited for very long periods of time for someone to take our drink order. They acted like they were not in any kind of hurry to assist a guest. Overall, we loved this hotel and will definitely return if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Unique position”
Reviews.Author: ElHabanero
Reviews.Content: You are in the heart of ancient Batrcelona ( Barrio Gotico ) with a totally re-styled 4 stars hotel. Staff is professional and cooperative. Good value for maoney. All the crucial hot-spots of the city at walking distance .

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: slamdunk09
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I just got back from a 5 night stay. The location is perfect--just steps from the Barcelona Cathedral and the wonderful shops, restaurants and winding streets of the gothic quarter. Everything was in walking distance--from the waterfront to the Segrada Familia, and we felt quite safe walking around there even late at night. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room and bath were very spacious. Although we looked out over the lively square, there was no noise with the windows closed. They even had our room ready the morning we arrived after a long day and night of traveling! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre and disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Bo2Netherlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the center of Barcelona Gothic quatre from July 11 to July 13. We booked a room via booking.com and were very disappointed upon arrival by the size of the room. The small double room felt suffocating (mind you, it doesn't look like the hotel pictures at all!) and therefor we asked for a superior at reception. Our superior was a pleasant size, so we decided to pay the extra 40 Euro's a night. However, the bathrobes and slippers were not in the room, as mentioned as a "standard" in the description. We were told they were out of stock and would be provided the next day. Also there was no newspaper, no Oreo biscuits, Wifi was out of order and no turndown service, as mentioned in the description. Ok, so far, no problem, these things happen. After roomservice cleaned our room the following day, we arrived back in our room, to find no bathrobes nor any slippers. Also the instant coffee had not been supplemented, nor were the showergels or any other bathing products. Our dirty towels had been neatly folded, but not cleaned. Again no sight of a newspaper and no turndown service. We had to telephone reception to ask (again) for bathrobes and slippers and decided to forget about the other things. After all, we are on a city trip, not on a hotel opinion/testing trip and all the other stuff is not really a necessity . I must say, we are not the demanding kind of people and (because of our airlinejobs), have stayed in a lot of different 4 star (or more) hotels all over the world. But this non existing service we never experienced before. Since we don't want to act as a "bore", we left after 2 nights, being charged 420 Euros, feeling somewhat disappointed. The good side of this hotel is without a doubt the location, walking distance from the catedral and a very pretty neighbourhood surrounding the catedral. But, if you are willing to pay over 400 Euros for 2 nights, I would pick Neri or something similar to Neri. In the end, the way staff makes you feel welcome does make a difference to an experience abroad. Besides this, to do as promised I myself find very important. Even just to prevent people from being disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL PROBABLY BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: marigoGreece
Reviews.Content: There's one thing to be said about this hotel.LOCATION.In the center of everything,culture,dining,transportation.All within walking distance.Rooms aren't big, but who stays inside while in Barcelona?Breakfast was satisfactory.My only problem was the noise during the night from a small Vietnamese joint beneath our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & well located ..!!”
Reviews.Author: RajuSuneja
Reviews.Content: Location is a plus it is in the heart of Barcelona, closeto La Ramblas. From there you can explore the city, you can walk to nearest restaurants and they are so many choices, you can also explore a lot of shops and stores, you can even walk by the beach if you prefer walking. The service is superb everything you request they do it promptly. It is clean, the room size is just perfet. Lastly the staff are friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: traveloverer
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have picked a better hotel! Arrived in Barcelona exhausted, took the airport bus straight to Placa Catalunya and was very pleased to find that hotel is only 5 minutes walk in the center of restaurants and shopping. La Rambla is also a quick 5-10 minute walk. Hotel is updated, contemporary and very well kept. There is small pool on the rooftop ample for chilling out and sunbathing. Didn't try the restaurant or the breakfast, but 16Euros is reasonable in Barcelona, trust me. The room was very nice and comfortable. I loved the rain shower in the bathroom. Most important - very clean. We were 3 and they set up an extra bed for my son. The staff was very pleasant and accommodated all our needs. If there is a downside, it was only that they couldn't give us our room when we arrived at 11am and we had to walk around town exhausted while we waited to be able to check in at 2pm. You can hang out by the pool area though, but it was hot and we opted to just start taking in the city. Stay here, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: fannb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel very close to the Catedral. The location is perfect for walking tours. The hotel looks recently renovated, and its style is very modern in all areas. My room has a very beautiful bathroom, great mattress, and the decoration just amazing. All services were excellent at this hotel. The staff is very helpful. I need to highlight the restaurant services, every morning there is a good buffet, and the waiter always assured we got the food we wanted even if were not in the buffet table.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, very central, yet quiet and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Hampshirehog9
Reviews.Content: Positioned right in the centre near Placa Catalunya, the Ramblas, and the cathedral, its an ideal location for a city break. Despite being at the centre of the hustle and bustle of this lively city, the hotel is an oasis of calm, quiet, and cool (in both senses!). The service is spot on, nothing was too much trouble. Ideally located if you are flying, being just 5 mins easy walk from where the Aerobus drops you at Placa Catalunya, and of course all the other transport links to all the tourist sights. Very good!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel overall enhanced by amazing reception staff”
Reviews.Author: DTG44
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at this hotel and it was in a perfect location. Hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable. In particular the reception staff were exceptional in their helpfulness and friendliness. In particular, you' be lucky to find Alex Blanco at the reception desk. We had problems with tickets we had bought and he offered to sort out the problem during his time off. We would highly recommend this hotel. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “VERY HELPFULL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: graham_hitchen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay again. During our stay, I had a dental problem and the staff could not have been more helpful in finding a local dentist to fix my crown. Location could not have been better for our 3 night break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel, excellent location within short walking distance of Las Ramblas. Friendly staff. Good breakfast buffet. Rooms are not very big.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsBassie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and enjoyed it a lot. It's easy to get to (take the bus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya and then walk for 5 minutes), and it's easy to explore the city from there thanks to the central location. Interior is neat, quite trendy, and the staff is friendly. The room was clean and nice, bed was good, and we didn't hear any noise from the outside (we did hear some noise from the corridor, but it was no big thing). The roof terrace & pool are also quite nice, nothing big though. To summarize: an excellent place for a citytrip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Doesnt get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: AnonBangor
Reviews.Content: Just one night in Barcelona and found this to be an ideal hotel. Been here many times so know the area well. The hotel ticked all the right boxes. I'd stay again for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous location..”
Reviews.Author: kentmummy
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 2 night stay at the Catalonia Catedral. We went for a sight seeing break and to have some time away from our little ones. The hotel is based in the hustle and bustle of central Barcalona, but the hotel is so peaceful and quiet. The rooms are very clean and modern. The shower is amazing, really warm and powerful. I never sleep well in hotels but we got woken up at 10am when the cleaner knocked to clean our room!! The room was really dark, cosy and quiet- perfect!! My only slight quibble would be that there were only 2 sheets on the bed, a blanket was provided in the cupboard but it would have been nice if there was a duvet on the bed. I am a very fussy person who likes to moan but I really cannot pick fault with this place. Great!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: MilanMarco
Reviews.Content: Last weekend (4-6 February) i flew from Milan to Barcelona to spend one weekend with a friend. I have been tens of times in Barca, but usually guest in friends' homes. This time i brought a colleague from work and I wanted to show her a fancy hotel in Barcelona. After some search i found out this hotel and i chose it for the exceptional position and the average rates. Arrived late on Friday we found out that it was really close to Plaza Catalunya and the Ramblas (really 5 min walk) and it was in a very nice position in a pedonal area. The hotel is small in the entrance but has an amazing style. It is clearly new, very stylish and a sophisticated (but not exaggerated) luxury. The rooms were really nice and, most of all, despite the very crowded streets around, the rooms were totally soundproof. Clean rooms, LCD tv, very large bathroom with large shower, style 360° degrees... We didn't have breakfast in the morning but we had a drink at the bar on the 1st floor, it looked like an Armani bar in MIlan!! I have been around the world the past 4 years and in tens of hotels in Barcelona but to be honest i would suggest everybody this amazing hotel, just as I like...small, intimate , sophisticated luxury and tranquility....with a price that, after all, is reasonable...Looking forward to come back........=)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: beachbumsLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona and our first stay at this hotel. The location is absolutely perfect as you are so close to the metro station, Las Rambles and the other main attractions including the Cathedral which is literally 5 buildings away. We found that everything was within walking distance and it is a great location for superb restaruants and other venues for evening entertainment. We found the cleaning service impecable and considering we stayed from the 29 December - 3 January, every day we found our room spotless, bed made and clean towels, even on New Years Day. Great value for money and one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The beds were very comfy and we had a brilliants night sleep every night (the usual European story though of two large single beds pushed together to make one large double bed). Another thing, there is a small kettle with coffee and tea making facilities which is rare in European hotels. We shall definately return to this hotel on our next return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel. worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: NFIA
Reviews.Content: i stayed 4 nights and i only can tell good things about it. Nice employees.. great location rooms, very clean and a great bathroom.. next time in Barcelona (this it was my fourth mas the 1st at this hotel, that only have a year) i will return do this hotel once more of course.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located, comfortable, clean. The staff is incredibly helpful. They provided everything we needed. The breakfast buffet was hard to believe at first, there were so many things to choose from. I don't know if I would have paid €16 per person for breakfast if I were paying myself, but I have to say that it was lacking nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: cruisingteacher
Reviews.Content: On April 2 2010 we made a reservation at this hotel for November 4 and November 5 in an upgraded balcony room. When we arrived at the hotel tired from a transatlantic flight, we were informed that they did not have a room for us. The Pope was visiting and apparently they resold our room at a higher price. I understand from Trip Advisor reviews that this happens but I thought that we would be okay since we arrived at 11:00AM. It was also apparent that this happens to Americans because the otherwise well spoken young lady behind the desk assured us that she would not send us to a "crappy" hotel. Seems she had picked up some American slang. We were taxied over to the Catalonia Ramblas, an older sister hotel. We did not receive the upgraded room that we paid for and received no compensation for this. We travel a lot and realize when we are being treated unfairly. So if you book this hotel, you need to hope that they will honor the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveWayne
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel located in the heart of the Gotic area (50M from La Rambla). Nice bar and restaurant. Great room with awesome shower. Free Wi-Fi. A rooftop pool with views of the city. Very comfortable bed. Will stay here whenever I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet location but rooms have no drawers for storing clothes”
Reviews.Author: WineXprt
Reviews.Content: I echo another reviewer -- there are absolutely no drawers for putting away clothes. They have to be put on two shelves in closet which are large, but inconvenient. Super location on a pedestrian street. Nice breakfast and we found the staff efficient and courteous and a little staff. Boutique style with small reception area. Zero drawers in all rooms is just stupid and annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the price !”
Reviews.Author: Ballmer
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay here in early July. Funky hotel with equally funky staff (in their own minds...). Only problem was the rate booked via Expedia didn't match what we were charged and in the rush to check out this was overlooked. Despite 3 letters to the hotel thereafter none have been answered. Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bleedgreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights before doing our cruise. Must say we were very happy with our experience. Great service, clean rooms, free wifi and in a perfect location near many shops and restaurants----and all for a price that doesnt break the bank. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Staff- Not so much”
Reviews.Author: SJTCHT
Reviews.Content: OK, first let me echo what everyone else says -- the location is PERFECT -- just a block away from Placa Catalunya (where EVERYTHING happens), and on an interesting pedestrian street adjacent to the Gothic Quarter. Also, if you're touring Barcelona during the summer, the small-but-adequate swimming pool is a great afternoon refresher. But the staff is uneven - some good, some not -- maybe even shady. At 7:35 one evening we needed a cab to take us to the train station -- since there is a very busy taxi rank about a block away, we were just going to pull our suitcases down the pedestrian block to where they were. However, the desk attendant insisted on callinng one for us. Fifteen minutes later we went back in to inquire about our cab. No problem, he said. At 8:00, still no cab (remember, there are at least 20 of them one block away), so we told him that we were going to walk -- No, he said, his cab was almost here; true enough, we hadn't walked for a minute when the cab intercepted us at 8:05 -- Guess what happens at 8:00 PM? THE TAXI RATES INCREASE!!! That was too much of a coincidence for us, Either the attendant called his special pal from way across town, or the hotel and taxi company have something going on -- because in one minute we drove right past the 20 cabs sitting and waiting at Placa Catalunya!! As a tourist, you have to be able to absolutely TRUST hoteliers, train station personnel, etc., and that was the exact opposite of our experience at hotel Catalunya!! (Perhaps that is why their ranking on TripAdvisorhas dropped so much since we visited Barcelona in July -- #9 back then!) However, Don't miss Barcelona -- Definitely one of Europe's greatest cities. Also, the on-and-off bus systems are the best (and most reasonably priced) in Europe -- and we've ridden on an awfully lot of them. The Bari Gotic walking tour hosted by the local Tourist Bureau was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Extremely Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: FredH149
Reviews.Content: Our room and bath were large and comfortable. The hotel is in Old Town and within easy walking distance of the Catedral and the City Bus Tour locations.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: basa12savta3
Reviews.Content: The plus -it is clean and has a good bathroom. The location is good. BUT this is a two-star hotel pretending to be 4 star. There was no bell staff till 5 p.m. -- the furniture is cheap and ugly, and the hanging closet small and half-taken by the safe and kettle. If you boil water, you steam your clothes. There is NOT ONE chest of drawers, no drawer space -- in a so-called four???? star hotel. I was told by the most pleasant Patricia that this is "hotel policy." Even the superior room (30E above the normal 159 E price) had no single drawer for clothing. How can a four-star hotel expect guests to live out of a suitcase. We left after one night,and for less than a superior room cost at the Catalonia Catedral found an excellent and well known hotel around the corner. In brief, stay away and when booking hotels in this chain, ask first if they have drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel a block from the Cathedral and within walking distance to many Barcelona highlights.”
Reviews.Author: Rene-SanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved Barcelona and the location of the Catalonia Catedral made it easy for us enjoy the ambiance of the Barri Gotic area and many of the city's major sights. Our hotel room overlooked a bustling little square where many people pass through on their way to or from the Cathedral, the nearby shops and boutiques or the lovely Placa de Catalunya. We asked for a balcony room on one of the highest floors because of a recommendation we saw on trip advisor. It allowed for great people watching but the noise from the square and street below wasn't too loud. Of the 5 nights we stayed in the hotel, only on Saturday night did we hear some loud voices for about an hour. But having the balcony was well worth enduring a little noise as we enjoyed the ambiance of the Barri Gotic in our room. Note that when we first looked at the room with the front desk attendant, the balcony doors and shades were shut and the room was rather dark. When I asked him to open one of them he said that the doors could not be opened and it sounded like they had to remain closed. I was disappointed but of the two rooms available at the time we preferred the one with the balcony because it was more spacious (also cost more but it was worth it.) I was relieved that he must have meant he himself could not open the doors because the bellhop had no problem opening them for us, which made the room so bright and enjoyable. There's a pool on the rooftop and even though the weather in May was delightful and warm, the pool water was rather cold. But we found it relaxing and quiet up there and enjoyed the warmth of the sun. Overall, the service at the hotel was very good - the housekeeping was impecable and once when we needed assistance from engineering because we blew a fuse, he came right away and fixed it. The only exception was the one guy at the front desk - perhaps he was new or didn't understand English well. Our friends were visiting Barcelona at the same time and we had planned to meet at the Catelonia Catedral if our cell phones didn't work, which they didn't. But when they went to our hotel on the 3rd day of our 5 day stay and asked for us, the front desk guy said there was no one staying there by that name! We highly recommend you take the Hop On, Hop Off bus tour. We did it 2 days in a row and saw and experienced so much very easily that way. The stop near the hotel is close to the Cathedral (cross the main street that's along the square for the Cathedral.) You can walk from the hotel to Las Ramblas in about 10 minutes and all the way down to the marina and beach, it isn't far at all - maybe a 20 minute stroll. I also walked to the Block of Discord neighborhood to see the Gaudi casas. Highly recommend going into Casa Mila, especially the artistic rooftop where you can enjoy 360 degree views of the city. Our room overlooked a great little restaurant with an outdoor patio that is above the Dali museum. We ate there twice and enjoyed the food and ambiance. A block away near the Cathedral, you'll find a great little place for tapas and next door is a gelato counter - both allow you to sit at tables outside and enjoy the amazing diversity of people walking by. There are also some restaurants in that square for breakfasts that have decent food, although the service is not like we are used to in the U.S. The servers we encountered in Barcelona seldom smile and don't go out of their way for you, so if you find the same kind of service, you won't have to take it personally! Otherwise, Barcelona is beautiful and fascinating in every way. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location. Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SunDogToronto
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the hotel is in a fantastic location. It is situated in the heart of the massive pedestrian area that is the gothic quarter. This is a great launching point to do almost anything in Barcelona. We walked everywhere with our 5 month old in the stroller. It really is a boutique hotel that gives you the feeling you must be paying so much more than you actually are to stay there. The design and attention to detail in the whole hotel is clear. Everything is so clean, and its easy to spot staff constantly ensuring everything is spotless. Also, the pool is really great to have on those days you want a swim/tan, but don't want to go to beach. The beach is a 30 min walk, but you can take the metro and then its only a 15 min walk from where it lets you off. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was beautiful. The linens were of a superior quality too. We had one of the rooms with a private terrace. The terrace was HUGE, and fun to unwind on at the end of the day. We had a travel cot (baby cot) set up in the room as we had pre-arranged. It was even set up with really cute linen with trucks printed on it. This, despite the unfriendly man at the front desk who had no idea if one was set up in our room, nor would he help us get one he said until the morning, that is, if one is available. I had pre-arranged over the telephone weeks ahead to ensure that we would get one. I truly want to say the staff was accommodating but we seemed to get stuck with this rude and distracted man at the front desk most times when we passed by or had a question. His name was Ricard I believe. Avoid asking this guy anything. He's too busy looking at his computer screen and clearly resents being interrupted. If it weren't for this experience we kept having with this man, we could have given 5 stars for service. In fact the only reason we gave 3 stars was that on the last day we lost our camera. The manager, a woman whose name I did not get really went out of her way to help us find our camera. I learned from this experience that there are friendly people who worked at the front desk, and perhaps we would give this hotel another try, as the rest of our experience with the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: plainchoc
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in fantastic location, within walking distance of tourist buses, metro, le ramblas etc. Roof top pool a bonus but that is where the good things stop. The rooms are tiny and with no storage at ll. All our luggage got stolen but it is probably a good thing as there was nowhere to put anything! It takes minimal to a whole new level. It was comfortable and bathroom was nice size however I have stayed in much better 4* hotels even in barcelona. The key card broke every day we were there (4) and so we had to keep going to reception to get it reprogrammed which was annoying. We met friends who stayed in a 3* round the corner they got a better rate, juliet balcony with a view and also a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality service & excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Endecot
Reviews.Content: It's great to find a hotel that is well run. There are so many places that cut corners and overlook detail.I am very hard to please. This hotel was perfect. Great staff,the rooms were spotless and luxurious and the location could not be better. What more can I say? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location, lovely rooms and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette006
Reviews.Content: We have found this hotel a great choice in Barcelona. It's just off La Rambla which is very busy, so the location is perfect. We did go for a superior room which is spacious, extremely comfortable and modern. Great bathroom. When we arrived, we were given a room at the front of the hotel which we found noisy as there was a festival on. No trouble whatsoever to move rooms. The staff have been ever so helpful, friendly and polite and they have good English. The breakfast is very good - cereal, fruit, juices, yoghurt, bacon, sausages, eggs, omlette (which you order), toast and there are cakes, sweets etc. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to be critical to dock points, but couldn't”
Reviews.Author: co2il
Reviews.Content: This place has a very weird first impression. It is right next to an open clothing storefront and may be easy to miss on first glance. The lobby is small and tight. Directly upstairs from the lobby is a beautiful indoor lounge/sitting area, a private outdoor patio with tables and a bar and internet counter (free) just off the seating area. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The head manager(I'm guessing) spoke perfect english and was very helpful. We had our luggage lost by AA and they helped us with places to shop and translating for us to the spanish speaking AA employees. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Our room was quiet, you get some noise from the hallway (wood floors), but not from outside. The curtains were blackout, which is dangerous if you want to be up early :-) Our room was 326 and had no complaints. I felt the pool closed too early and never got the chance to use it, but can't think of anything else wrong with the hotel. Would definitely stay again if had to make the choice again. The hotel is also located in easy walking distance to both the Catalunya and Jaume plaza for metro, airport trans, and many buses.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: micsylim
Reviews.Content: Hotel is walking distance from the airport bus and the shopping district of Barcelona. Superb choice.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: nancyoc7
Reviews.Content: Location was very good. Was there at the start of Sept. Easy to get to everyplace from here. I enjoyed the friendly and pleasant staff. The room was clean had air conditioning so very comfortable. Excellent facilities, loved the roof top pool, great views of the city. Would recommend and may be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location - Services not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Bilk024
Reviews.Content: Smallish hotel, but great location. Our standard room was small and elegantly furnished, 10/10 for the bathroom. Room needed more storage space throughout. If you get one of the rooms at the back of the hotel, you are overlooked, so tendency is to keep curtains drawn further reducing space in the room. Room cleaning missed a couple of dirty coffee cups & did not replenish coffee etc. Staff at reception friendly and helpful, but on 3 occasions the room access card failed to work. We think they input the wrong number of nights we were staying on the computer - twice. Pool on the roof small, but very well maintained - could do with some umbrellas to provide some shade. Drinks machines empty for the 3 visits we made. Internet access via a couple of PC's in the bar area very good & free. Overall a good hotel, but not quite a 4 star considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: srk2fd
Reviews.Content: After failing to honor our reservations, we were told to find another hotel to stay at. With much pleading we were finally given a two bed room for the three of us - and were still treated rudely. Only to find out that we were charged for two nights, when we only stayed one! I have been emailing them back and forth and get a response to every third or fourth email I send - and although they acknowledge the mistake they still won't refund my card. The room itself is clean and pretty luxurious - but at over 150 euros a night is way overpriced. Location is decent although it's a pretty good walk to the bus/subway

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our trip to Spain”
Reviews.Author: Judy_P51
Reviews.Content: Clean, bright, modern, good bathroom, good AC. Good dinning room and breakfast buffet. Very courteous and helpful staff - all spoke good englis

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: katie3110
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights prior to a cruise at the beginning of July. I had looked it up on Trip Advisor and were more than happy with the hotel. We had upgraded to a deluxe room and it was very big and spacious the same for the bathroom. It is a very boutique hotel and I could not recommend it more highly

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: CHNJ1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on our first trip to Spain - traveling with 18 and 22 year old sons. Everything about the hotel is perfect. The staff is friendly and helpful, including the Hotel Manager. Rooms are spotless and spacious with lovely bathrooms. The pool is a perfect way to spend the siesta on a hot afternoon. And the location is central to everything. If you can spring for the extra amount, we highly recommend the premium rooms with the balconies - worth the extra euros! All in all an outstanding experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel find-style, service and ideal location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: styletraveler7
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this hotel. This hotel was a jewel of a find. Perfect, central location that was the just the right distance to but not on the busy Rambla--thankfully--a two minute walk to Placa Cataluna-which is where alll the marjor conveniences you need (shopping center, metro, airport bus and taxi drop, day tour pickup, and the tourist info center). Very safe and just a corner away from the Cathedral, which I enjoyed walking to every morning. A wonderful bonus was the trendy stores just steps away...shoes, clothes, food, and even an H&M! My room was spacious and clean and filled with every amenity I could ever want--strong AC, minibar, fashionalble club chair, large bath, flat screen tv, modern art and a window view of the interior courtyard and local residential building. Stay on the 4th floor for easy access to the pool. The rooftop pool was a welcomed break after busy days of sightseeing. They offer happy hour -- try the mojitos! I cant say enough wonderful things about this hotel. It was the best choice of my two-week european vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: desacadienserrants
Reviews.Content: We loved the vibe of this hotel; very modern yet comfortable. The rooms are small (at least our level of room was small), but functional. The rooftop pool was a treat, a great way to end off the day. But the best part was the location. Minutes from Las Ramblas, the waterfront, and all the shopping and restaurants you could imagine. That's really what you're paying for here, and you do get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jen_stafford
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel, and would highly recommended it for couples, travelling friends although not the most child orientated hotel. Great location, very easy to find. No need to get a taxi from the airport there is a aerobus directly from the airport to the main square costing costing 5.05 euros, 2-3 minute walk and your at the hotel. Hotel is very contemporary, lovely bar and sitting areas. Rooms were an a good size, air conditioned, the most comfy hotel bed ever! Bathroom was fantastic, programmable safe, LCD tv - overall Fantastic! We chose the hotel initially because a roof terrace with a smallish pool - that was very much needed for us to cool off in! Overall Excellent - Breakfast was a little pricy but there plenty of places to eat just around the square

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, modern, friendly and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Grifflar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. On checking in we were met by a friendly male receptionist who checked us in, explained about the area and passed us to the very capable concierge who took our cases to the rooms, showed us around the ameneties in the hotel and our lovely room. The rooms are very clean, modern although not particulary large, with a mini bar and safe. Beds are comfortable, and linen crisp and clean, bathroom large, clean with complementary toiletry packs. The bar & restaurant/breakfast room are of equally high standard, breakfast is fab, and the the brasserie food is delicious and quite reasonably priced, they are also offering a 15% discount for residents at the moment. Staff are both very friendly and helpful. The sun terrace is small yet very adequate and the pool is ideal to cool off in and drink an early evening cocktail by. Overall location is ideal, you are central to all public transport, and major tourist spots are only a stones throw away. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: salstar77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. It is close to all the main Barcelona attractions. It is very charming, comfortable and a very great value. The only complaint we have is that they had a false alarm the first night we arrived. Also, the bar service was very slow and the bartender was mostly unavailable and when he/she was around he/she was very inexperienced. Also, the front desk is understaffed during the night and early morning. We had to take our luggage downstairs when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HR2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for 4 days and we loved the location of this hotel. It was easy to get to from the airport and close to Plaza Catalunya, the Cathedral, Las Ramblas, the Born area among others. The room was very clean and nice and the bathroom was great too. Would definitely recommend. Other reviews said it was noisy but we didn't have any issues with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Not Available”
Reviews.Author: BeatenPathTokyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Calalonia Catedral for 3 nights because free wireless internet access was supposed to be available in rooms. All through our stay, however, internet was unavailable. Every morning the staffs at reception told us it would be fixed within the day, but it was never fixed. We were told we should go to StarBucks as internet is available there. If you need internet access in your room, you should avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel 5 mins walk from the Ramblas.”
Reviews.Author: mikeandmaria_uk
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at this hotel in one of the Premium terrace rooms. This had a private sundeck that had its own gate to the rooftop pool and sundeck. Absolutely fantastic. The rooms and the roof area are really really quiet even though you have busy Barcelona centre below. Allowed for fantastic lay ins if you wanted! The staff were extremely polite and couldnt have been more helpful. We will be staying here again later in the year. The Ramblas is about 5 mins walk away and its right in the middle of the main shopping area if you want it. Right opposite the Hotel is Circulo Artistico Terrace restaurant and we had 2 wonderful meals there and the Sangria is amazing. It ticked all the boxes for us, 10 out of 10. Another tip is, dont waste 30euros taking a cab from the airport. Catch the Aerobus which is right outside T2. Its 6 euros, is air conditioned and is just as quick as a cab. Its a great service that takes you right into the Place de Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: hadarami
Reviews.Content: great hotel. new or recently renovated. very friendly staff. they let us have a late checkout becuse our flight was delayed, no charge. the breakfest was very good: good cheese, pastery, fruit, juice, coffee etc. located just outside the cathedral, minutes of walking from la ramblas, and in a good shopping street (zara, pull and bear, h&m...). the rooms are small but comfy. the shower has a raindrop like option, andthere is a safe wich come in handy. the wi-fi was not working well, but it was free/ there was 1 free laptop on the bar, but it wasn't working. there is a small pool on the roof. i enjoyed it a lot after traveling all over europe, and staying in quite a few hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: PallasParis
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in January and in June 2010. This is a new hotel with an excellent location, right next to the old city center, by the Cathedral and a very short walk to the Catalunya Plaza, major subway and bus hub. From the airport, a taxi costs about 25 Euros. The Premium rooms are spacious, clean with large bathroom, lots of closets, nice design and offer water bottles, small snacks, bathrobe and slippers, etc. I really like the rooms, the whole hotel design, but make sure you ask for a room towards the courtyard because otherwise it’s a bit noisy from the streets. Shops, restaurants, cafés etc are all right there, just outside the hotel. The hotel has a small pool on the terrace, a bar and a restaurant where breakfast is served. The breakfast is fine though a bit costly (16 Euros) for what it is. The people at the reception and the manager are very friendly and go out of their way to help customers. In general, I highly recommend this hotel if you’re staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with unfriendly staff that doesn't really care for their guests”
Reviews.Author: MABLU
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, too bad the staff is very unfriendly and doesn't really care for their guests. Had to spend the first night in a other Catalonia Hotel (not to compare with the Catalonia Catedral) because of overbooking. Only because we insisted we could finally move to the hotel we booked and payed for the day after! They didn't really care.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: CardiffSkis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 1 night post cruise at this charming hotel. Arrived very early and the helpful staff took our luggage while we went to the Sagrada Familia and the Parc Guell. Our room was extremely comfortable particularly the bed(with a huge terrace),large TV with lots of English channels for our 11 year old daughter. Pool was small but perfect for a late afternoon cool down. Had a delicious dinner in the restaurant. Went out for breakfast to Bar Lobo which I would highly recommend.Free internet was also a plus. Location - 5 minutes from the Boqueira,next to the cathedral,2 minutes to the Ramblas,10 minutes from the Picasso Museum makes it exceptionally convenient. Only regret was that we were only there for 1 night,it is perfect for a longer stay....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, impeccably clean, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mollsker
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous boutique hotel located just a block or so off the northern end of the Ramblas. It is in a superb location - we like to walk cities to see the sites and we were able to easily do this from this hotel. It's very clean, the staff are English speaking and very helpful. They held our bags for us on our last day and as we came back to pick them up they said that the maid had just called to say we had left a bag in the room. It happened to have all of our dressy clothes for our cruise so we were very grateful they had notified us. There is a very cute terrace restaurant right across from the hotel that you might miss if you don't know it's there. The food is very good there but the service is poor and they do charge a bread fee, but it is a very romantic spot and worth having a meal there. The hotel also had excellent food and they just opened up a little terrace area for diners so that is a good place to have dinner as well. Internet access was free and the hotel was reasonably priced for the amenities. We will be staying at the Catalonia Catedral next time we are in Barcelona. We couldn't ask for a more comfortable and well- located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: laura3334
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a few of the Catalonia Group Hotels and this certainly was to the same usual standard, especially the beds which are of the best I have slept in in any hotel and great cosy pillows. Excellent location, close to Ramblas and all other main attractions, but quiet and tranquil area. Neat and clean rooms with a funky modern theme. I definately recommend the restaurant, fabulous food, with very reasonable prices in a nice relaxed atmosphere (they don´t rush you). We will most surely be back there later this year, as Barcelona itself is a beautiful city, One small issue not really even worth mentioning but...we were locked out the Hotel one nigiht coming back at 1am for 15 minutes as the Consierge it seemes was preapring himself some food in the kitchen. A good sign I suppose that they take security seriously and lock the doors,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean/cool hotel, but wow..the noise”
Reviews.Author: kinglolo
