Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that the Catalonia Catedral has the most brilliant, centralized location in Barcelona in our humble opinion. Smack dab in the center of the Gothic District, you're close to La Rambla, Picasso museum, parks, great restaurants, the metro, etc. The rooms are modern, spacious and very clean. The restaurant is great, very comfortable delicious food and the bar is a hip, little area with a flatscreen playing soccer. The only complain, a pretty major one at that since it cost my wife and I much sleep during our three nights there, was the hallway noise--specifically the shutting of doors. For some reason, all of the doors in this hotel are all weighted to shut with the most impact right before closing, giving off a deafening, eching "BAM!" every time one shuts. We're not light sleepers, nor are we overly sensitive to noise (since most hotels in Europe are semi-loud you deal with as audible ambiance), but this was insane. We ended up both having to purchase earplugs to get through the night and were still woken up late and early. It's kind of a shame that they did not take this into consideration when putting all of the other details together for this place, because other than this, the place is an ideal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central - clear and calm”
Reviews.Author: Achim444
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. Our room was in the 4th floor, no noise & clean. The breakfast buffet was fresh and plentyful. The hotel is very central (1 minute from cathedral) so that we made a break during the day easily. Very good for a city break in barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, central to all”
Reviews.Author: jpayola
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location for seeing Ciutat Vella, La Ribera, L'Eixample, etc. A couple minutes walk from Placa Catalunya (main drop off spot for the Aerobus from the Airport). The place is very clean and has a very modern decor. The rooms are well done and a decent size. Its quiet for the most part, however like most of the hotels we stayed at in Spain, you could hear hallway noise somewhat easily. It seems like the doors dont have soundproof seals or something. It was minor though, I didnt lose any sleep over it. One small complaint. The fan/AC in our room didn't work. Maintenance came up and looked at it and said they would take care of it. Nothing happened. We called the next day again and the front desk said someone would look at it. They never did. Our only relief from the stuffy room was the maid service unlocked the balcony doors for us (which I don't think they are normally supposed to do seeing that door handle was purposely removed). If it weren't for the maid, we would have sweltered in there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: patty_kramer38
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location of the old part of the city,short walk from the Plaza Catalunia. The hotel is a very modern and trendy hotel, the rooms are clean and stylish,have flat screen tv'swith okay channels (limited English language) No queen sized bed but two singles pushed together which seems to be the norm in Europe. Bathrooms are again very modern and stylish and are a good size. Staff at the hotel offer excellent customer service and the manager of the Catalonia Catedral went above and beyond the call of duty when we had a problem in the down town area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tijmen
Reviews.Content: Great place. Rooms nice, staff is friendly, etc etc, But best of al, it's in a great location. Next to the catedral, but of the Laeitana. So it's quit, you can sleep late if you want, and it's 10 minutes to the beach on 1 side, and 10 to the Segrada on the other side. Stayed with my son, and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - fully satisfied”
Reviews.Author: StefanoBruxelles
Reviews.Content: Went back, this time on business and for a night only. Booked a standard room this time (last time superior w/terrace). I fully confirm the excellent impression I had the first time: great location, great value for money, the hotel is still spotlessly clean and the staff friendly and useful. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Jill1957
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in total in this lovely, new hotel. It is in the most central location, in the pedestrianised " old town", around the corner from the Cathedral. Helpful, friendly staff, spacious, comfortable rooms. We paid extra for rooms on the third floor, overlooking the street. The beds were very clean,large and comfortable with modern amenities. The breakfast was 10 euros and a sumptuous buffet. Great shopping and tapas bars closeby and a short stroll to the Ramblas and all the sights. Walk everywhere and when you tire, taxis are a cheap way of getting back close to the hotel. Barcelona is a beautiful city and this is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, Comfortable, Clean and Cool”
Reviews.Author: Litro_K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for work and was very pleased with everything - my room was huge, clean, and stylish. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice, and staff went out of their way to be helpful. It was also located in a really nice part of the old town and was extremely well-placed for getting around the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, good-sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: wagirl2
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Catedral was a great place to start our stay in Spain. The hotel is less than a five-minute walk from where the airport bus ends at Plaza Catalunia. From there, it's a one-minute walk to the Catedral. The hotel just opened last fall, and it's done in a very modern style. We stayed in a junior suite, and, by European standards, it was large. The bathroom was huge, clean, and luxurious, with granite tile extending up the walls. Variety of lights to create whatever type of ambience you want. Free Wifi. large flatscreen TV. Staff were very friendly as they helped me figure out how to get from place to place. Only two downsides: first, during the day, we could hear the music of a store located under the hotel. This might not be true for all the rooms, especially those up higher, but we were just one floor-level up from the street. Second, on my first night, jetlagged, I just wanted to order room service, but they seemed to be out of a lot of things. I settled on a pizza, and it came 'crispy'. Recommendation: eat out.

Reviews.Title: “nice place - great location”
Reviews.Author: expat72
Reviews.Content: Yesterday we came back from Barcelona - spending there 2 days - in order to visit and feel the atmosphere of this lovely city. Catalonia Catedral 4* was OK for a base to stay. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You get it all: great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Steinera
Reviews.Content: The hotel Catedral is brand new and everything about it is a pleasure: the rooms are beautifully decorated in black and white although not overly large. It is very stylish and modern. The comfortable beds come with so many pillows that we put most of them in the cupboard. There is a big desk, a minibar, coffee maker and even decorative pottery on the shelf. Internet is free. The bathroom is big with thick soft towels. Could not possibly be better than that. There is a small reception on the bottom floor and then you take the lift to the first floor where the lobby is situated and from there you take the elevators to the rooms. A bit strange but nice because it gives a feeling of privacy. The hotel is made up of 4 old buildings that have been connected and so there is a small nicely decorated courtyard in the middle. The breakfast room was nice although service would have been better. If you like cake and pastry for breakfast you are going to enjoy it. There is also a wide choice of fresh juices, fruit pieces and the eternal spanish "jamon". If you like healthy breakfasts, you might have a problem. And last but not least: location!!!! The hotel is situated on a pedestrian street that is just a few meters away from the cathedral in the old city (barrio gotic). Since there are no cars it is very quiet and peaceful both in the lobby and in the rooms. (Please note though that no cars will be able to let you off at the entrance). When looking for "action" you just step into the sreet: to your left is the cathedral square with restaurants, bars and coffee places (when we visited the was a huge christmas market covering most of the square). If you turn right you get right into one of the nicest shopping streets (although there are many more places to shop). The historic area and the Ramblas are 3 minutes away. In whichever direction you choose to go (and whatever time of day or night) you will be surrounded by people, both tourists and locals. Great as long as you remember that is is a must to keep an eye on your purse and bags -pick pocketing seems to be a great sport in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “every thing was perfect”
Reviews.Author: rbhtc
Reviews.Content: the stuff the location the breakfast the rooms all first class. a peaceful quiet lovely hotel. ran, israel

Reviews.Title: “Good food, good service!!”
Reviews.Author: mattnemski
Reviews.Content: Would thoroughly recommend. Very helpful staff. Perfectly situated hotel in the Barri Gotica area...right near to the Gothic cathedral..plenty of shops, restaurants and bars nearby to keep you occupied. Lovely modern room, very clean. Breakfast was good, plenty for everyone, staff are very helpful. Would like to go back to this hotel again, soon.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: fusun
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Manager was so helpfull to arange our rooms,hotel location was very close every where.The staff who is working at breakfast room was very kind, breakfast was delicous

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in a fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: Readie73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay, the staff were all extremely polite from checking in to checking out. The hotel has just been completely modernised and hadn't been open very long so everything was very clean and fresh looking. Rooms were spacious with a large bathroom equipped with a shower and bath and the beds were very comfy (loved the pillows). Only negative point was that our room was directly above the shops below and loud music could be heard from 9.30am until 9.45pm, although we were out most of the day, this was annoying when we returned to the hotel mid afternoon for a siesta - tip, ask for a room on a higher level. We did have a drink in the bar area, and found this lacked any atmosphere since we were the only ones there, and we didn't try the hotel restaurant for the same reason, although the menu looked appealing - the waiter explained that it was very quiet due to it being a new hotel and nobody really knowing it was there yet. Would we go back again?? I'm already looking at dates!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: MrsHedgehog
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here. It has recently been refurbished and has been done to a very high standard. We arrived to book in and although the reservation hadn't got to the hotel (Late rooms) that was no problem. We were shown to our room by a very friendly curteous young man. The room was lovely, huge bed, very comfy. The room was facing an inner courtyard but even the stones were clean. The breakfast was a buffet which was well worth partaking. Set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “The Core of the Onion”
Reviews.Author: JDougl
Reviews.Content: This was how the Bellboy described the location of this hotel, and it is absolutely true. Perfect for anywhere in the Barri Gotic and also for excursions into Eixample. The hotel is very modern and the staff friendly and approachable. The only reason we could find to knock some points off this hotel was the astronomical prices at the bar (the barmaid even apologised before telling me the price of two drinks) Overall this was the perfect way to experience Barcelona.
